column5: Mine would be the mepps black fury#2/3.
hammered brass #4 indiana with 4mm red beads on a 20# three foot leader. I've caught trout, walleye, perch, northerns and whitefish on this rig.
3 to 5 Aglia..... worm/bait harness is another thing. I make my own.
Bucktail harness
If I had to pick one it'd be a #2 or #3 E.G.B. spinner with a hammered copper blade.
Small 1/16th or 1/32nd oz Panther Martin...  I like the silver blade with black body....
That too, has been my favourite for small stream specks, often with a bit of orange in the feather dressing too along with the black.
The reason why I like them so much is that it doesn't take much current, or a fast retrieve to get the blade going..   I love fan casting these things and letting them sit infront of log jams, etc...
If just one it would have to be #3 Mepps Aglia Silver Blade with Hooks Dressed in Black.

I'd be happy to settle down with my Panther Martin #20 with gold blade and yellow/red-fleck body.  Yeah, #20.  I can toss it all spring for shallow lakers and big fat pike.    And this coming summer we'll see how it does 30-40 feet down on the lead core...or possibly behind the dipsy
Mine would be a Blue Fox #2 or #3 in Silver or Gold.
#2 Mepps Black Fury.........
Thats exactly what I was thinking...
Hard to go wrong with a #3 Mepps Black Fury.  I like burning it in fast enough to bulge the wake a bit like a top-water.
black fury all the way.  early may, casting trees with a black fury is the most exciting brook trout fishing imaginable!  killer strikes!!!
Mepps 3 long in green, orange and yellow. Runs a little deeper and always works when all else fails.
Blue Fox #5 with custom fur and feathers tied by my brother Joonmoon.
Super Vibrax all the way!
Blue Fox Vibrax #3-5 Fire Tiger and Silver
Blue Fox #4 Vibrax, Fire Tiger...caught Steelhead, Coho, Pike, Smallmouth...my go to spinner!
Pike & Walleye - Mepps Aglia #5 Pike, Walleye, Bass - Blue Fox #5 Muskie - Rockstar Lures (made by board member Mepps)
